entries.name: FILENAME_COMPLETION_PROC
entries.desc:
The Object with the call method that is a completion for filename. This is
sets by ::completion_proc=
method.

entries.name: HISTORY
entries.desc:
The history buffer. It extends Enumerable module, so it behaves just like
an array. For example, gets the fifth content that the user input by HISTORY.

entries.name: USERNAME_COMPLETION_PROC
entries.desc:
The Object with the call method that is a completion for usernames. This is
sets by ::completion_proc=
method.

entries.name: VERSION
entries.desc: Version string of GNU Readline or libedit.

entries.name: basic_quote_characters → stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Gets a list of quote characters which can cause a word break.

entries.name: basic_quote_characters = stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Sets a list of quote characters which can cause a word break.

entries.name: basic_word_break_characters → stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Gets the basic list of characters that signal a break between words for the completer routine.

entries.name: basic_word_break_characters = stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Sets the basic list of characters that signal a break between words for the completer routine. The default is the characters which break words for completion in Bash: “ tn"\'`@$><=;|&{(”.

entries.name: completer_quote_characters → stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Gets a list of characters which can be used to quote a substring of the line.

entries.name: completer_quote_characters = stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Sets a list of characters which can be used to quote a substring of the line. Completion occurs on the entire substring, and within the substring ::completer_word_break_characters are treated as any other character, unless they also appear within this list.

entries.name: completer_word_break_characters → stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Gets the basic list of characters that signal a break between words for rl_complete_internal().

entries.name: completer_word_break_characters = stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Sets the basic list of characters that signal a break between words for rl_complete_internal(). The default is the value of ::basic_word_break_characters.

entries.name: completion_append_character → charclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a string containing a character to be appended on completion. The default is a space (“ ”).

entries.name: completion_append_character = charclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Specifies a character to be appended on completion. Nothing will be appended if an empty string (“”) or nil is specified.

entries.name: completion_case_fold → boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if completion ignores case. If no, returns false.

entries.name: completion_case_fold = boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Sets whether or not to ignore case on completion.

entries.name: completion_proc → procclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the completion Proc object.

entries.name: completion_proc = procclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Specifies a Proc object proc to determine completion behavior. It should take input string and return an array of completion candidates.

entries.name: completion_quote_character → charclick to toggle source
entries.desc: When called during a completion (e.g. from within your ::completion_proc), it will return a string containing the character used to quote the argument being completed, or nil if the argument is unquoted.

entries.name: delete_text([start[, length]]) → selfclick to toggle source
emacs_editing_mode → nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Specifies Emacs editing mode. The default is this mode. See the manual of GNU Readline for details of Emacs editing mode.

entries.name: emacs_editing_mode? → boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if emacs mode is active. Returns false if not.

entries.name: filename_quote_characters → stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Gets a list of characters that cause a filename to be quoted by the completer when they appear in a completed filename.

entries.name: filename_quote_characters = stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Sets a list of characters that cause a filename to be quoted by the completer when they appear in a completed filename. The default is nil.

entries.name: get_screen_size → [rows, columns]click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the terminal's rows and columns.

entries.name: input = inputclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Specifies a File object input that is input stream for ::readline method.

entries.name: insert_text(string) → selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Insert text into the line at the current cursor position.

entries.name: line_buffer → stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the full line that is being edited. This is useful from within the complete_proc for determining the context of the completion request.

entries.name: output = outputclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Specifies a File object output that is output stream for ::readline method.

entries.name: point → intclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the index of the current cursor position in Readline.line_buffer.

entries.name: point = intclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Set the index of the current cursor position in Readline.line_buffer.

entries.name: pre_input_hook → procclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a Proc object proc to call after the first prompt has been printed and just before readline starts reading input characters. The default is nil.

entries.name: pre_input_hook = procclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Specifies a Proc object proc to call after the first prompt has been printed and just before readline starts reading input characters.

entries.name: quoting_detection_proc → procclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the quoting detection Proc object.

entries.name: quoting_detection_proc = procclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Specifies a Proc object proc to determine if a character in the user's input is escaped. It should take the user's input and the index of the character in question as input, and return a boolean (true if the specified character is escaped).

entries.name: readline(prompt = "", add_hist = false) → string or nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Shows the prompt and reads the inputted line with line editing. The inputted line is added to the history if add_hist is true.

entries.name: redisplay → selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Change what's displayed on the screen to reflect the current contents.

entries.name: refresh_line → nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Clear the current input line.

entries.name: set_screen_size(rows, columns) → selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Set terminal size to rows and columns.

entries.name: special_prefixes → stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Gets the list of characters that are word break characters, but should be left in text when it is passed to the completion function.

entries.name: special_prefixes = stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Sets the list of characters that are word break characters, but should be left in text when it is passed to the completion function. Programs can use this to help determine what kind of completing to do. For instance, Bash sets this variable to “$@” so that it can complete shell variables and hostnames.

entries.name: vi_editing_mode → nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Specifies VI editing mode. See the manual of GNU Readline for details of VI editing mode.

entries.name: vi_editing_mode? → boolclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if vi mode is active. Returns false if not.
